qas.question: Which parks hosts the Winter Bash?
Which festival draws up to 3 million people?
What is the country music festival in Detroit called?

context: Annual summer events include the Electronic Music Festival, International Jazz Festival, the Woodward Dream Cruise, the African World Festival, the country music <a4_0>Hoedown<a4_0/>, Noel Night, and Dally in the Alley. Within downtown, <a0_0>Campus Martius Park<a0_0/> hosts large events, including the annual Motown Winter Blast. As the world's traditional automotive center, the city hosts the North American International Auto Show. Held since 1924, <a1_0>America's Thanksgiving Parade<a1_0/> is one of the nation's largest. <a2_0>River Days<a2_0/>, a five-day summer festival on the International Riverfront lead up to the <a3_0>Windsor–Detroit International Freedom Festival<a3_0/> fireworks, which draw super sized-crowds ranging from hundreds of thousands to over three million people.
